text: Transgender rights in the United Kingdom have been gaining ground since the 1990s, with the granting of rights and protection to the transgender community (LGBT). Various laws within the United Kingdom refer to identity documents, marriage rights, and anti-discrimination measures used by or pertaining to transgender people, in the areas of employment, education, housing and social services, amongst others. Category:LGBT rights in the United Kingdom Category:LGBTQ politics in the United Kingdom
title: Transgender rights in the United Kingdom
